pullRequest.body:
Introduces a new class, `PerfectSpace`, which requires that `Set.univ` is a perfect set. This is equivalent to say that no points are isolated (`perfectSpace_iff_forall_not_isolated`).

---

This PR is part of my effort to formalize Rubin's theorem into Mathlib.
See https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Defining.20perfect.20spaces for the zulip discussion on this subject.

- [ ] depends on: #10272

This PR has been stripped down to only the changes that I critically need to progress in my formalization of Rubin's theorem, since I want to keep the PR chain for it as small as possible.

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

Looks like `Filter` is open twice, all these lines can be replaced with just `open Topology Filter Set TopologicalSpace`

```suggestion
section PerfectSpace

variable (Œ±)

/--
A topological space `X` is said to be perfect if its universe is a perfect set.
Equivalently, this means that `ùìù[‚â†] x ‚â† ‚ä•` for every point `x : X`.
-/
class PerfectSpace : Prop :=
  univ_perfect' : Perfect (Set.univ : Set Œ±)

theorem PerfectSpace.univ_perfect [PerfectSpace Œ±] : Perfect (Set.univ : Set Œ±) :=
  PerfectSpace.univ_perfect'

end PerfectSpace

section Preperfect
```
The `variable X in` usage should probably be avoided if possible.

```suggestion
instance PerfectSpace.not_isolated [PerfectSpace X] (x : X) : Filter.NeBot (ùìù[‚â†] x) := by
  simpa [AccPt] using (PerfectSpace.univ_perfect X).acc _ (Set.mem_univ x)

theorem perfectSpace_iff_forall_not_isolated : PerfectSpace X ‚Üî ‚àÄ x : X, Filter.NeBot (ùìù[‚â†] x) :=
  ‚ü®@PerfectSpace.not_isolated _ _,
    fun h_forall ‚Ü¶ ‚ü®‚ü®isClosed_univ, fun _ _ ‚Ü¶ by simpa [AccPt] using h_forall _‚ü©‚ü©‚ü©
```

```suggestion
  PerfectSpace.univ_perfect'
```

```suggestion
@[mk_iff perfectSpace_def]
class PerfectSpace: Prop :=
```

This generates a lemma `perfectSpace_def` which allows you to rewrite `PerfectSpace` into `Perfect univ`. We don't always do this, but it's a good practice.
That's good to know
What about using `Preperfect` here, since the closedness condition is redundant?

If you add `@[mk_iff perfect_def]` above the definition of `Perfect` (you can see the generated lemma by hovering over its name), you can do:
```suggestion
theorem perfectSpace_iff_forall_not_isolated : 
    PerfectSpace X ‚Üî ‚àÄ x : X, Filter.NeBot (ùìù[‚â†] x) := by
  simp [perfectSpace_def, perfect_def, Preperfect, AccPt]

instance PerfectSpace.not_isolated [PerfectSpace X] (x : X) : Filter.NeBot (ùìù[‚â†] x) := 
  perfectSpace_iff_forall_not_isolated.mp ‚Äπ_‚Ä∫ x
```
Note that we don't need `preperfect_def` because `Preperfect` is a def so you can just rewrite through it.
